intro: Mozinna spathulata var. sessiliflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mozinna, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of East Asia. It features lanceolate, sessile leaves that are often hairy and arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
